title-group.article-title: Love: Complement or Redundancy of Justice? A Levinasian Revisiting of Ricœur's Dialectic of Love and Justice

abstract.p: This article reviews Paul Ricœur's account of the dialectical opposition between justice and love. First, I explore the dissonances between the just and the good in the practice of justice. Secondly, a review of the different interpretations of the Biblical Golden Rule and the commandment of love is presented, considering how the creative tension between them and the supraethical dimensions of creation, revelation, and redemption revise and correct justice. Finally, I present a critique of this dialectical process while reconsidering — through several Levinasian propositions — the very conception of justice.
